We've all had those moments when we've been inspired by the resilience of one group, only to be disheartened by the lack of progress in another.

In contrast, other groups may struggle with internal conflicts, lack of cohesion, or external barriers. But is it not precisely these challenges that make their successes all the more remarkable? Is it not the very adversity they face that sets them apart from their more privileged counterparts?
